Properties.Name: Caption
Properties.Value: Welcome to the Assisted Setup for Power BI

Properties.Name: InstructionalText
Properties.Value: This will guide you through how to connect to Power BI and configure how your data will be displayed.

Properties.Name: InstructionalText
Properties.Value: Choose Next to set up the connector

Properties.Name: InstructionalText
Properties.Value: Defines which type of calendar the year boundaries are applied to during Date table generation in Power BI. Using Weekly, the first and last day of the year might not correspond to a first and last day of a month, respectively.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Specifies the first day of a week and defines when a week starts in a weekly calendar. US calendars typically use 0 (Sunday), whereas European calendars use 1 (Monday)

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Specifies which country to use in order to set the holidays in the calendar as non-working days

Properties.Name: InstructionalText
Properties.Value: A standard monthly calendar that begins on January 1 and ends on December 31

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Specifies the first month of the Fiscal calendar. If set to 1, the fiscal monthly calendar is identical to the standard calendar.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Specifies the first day of a week. US calendars typically use start on Sunday, whereas European calendars start on Monday

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Specifies which country to use in order to set the holidays in the calendar as non-working days

Properties.Name: InstructionalText
Properties.Value: A fiscal monthly calendar where the year starts on the first day of a month that is not January

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Specifies the starting period for the Fiscal Weekly calendar.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Specifies the first day of a week and defines when a week starts in the Fiscal Weekly calendar. US calendars typically start on Sunday, whereas European calendars start on Monday

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Specifies which country to use in order to set the holidays in the calendar as non-working days

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Specifies the end of the year definition for the Fiscal Weekly calendar. Last: Last weekday of the month at Fiscal year end. Nearest: Last weekday nearest the end of month.

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Specifies the number of weeks per period in each quarter. Quarters which always count 13 weeks in the Fiscal Weekly calendar

Properties.Name: InstructionalText
Properties.Value: A fiscal weekly calendar that supports: 4-4-5, 4-5-4, or 5-4-4

Properties.Name: ToolTip
Properties.Value: Specifies the time zone for Power BI related dates.

Properties.Name: InstructionalText
Properties.Value: Defines the UTC time zone in the Power BI date table.

Properties.Name: InstructionalText
Properties.Value: Defines the range of dates to be generated in the Power BI date table. Fields are set automatically based on Accounting Periods. If there are budgets that extend past the last date in the Accounting Periods table, you will need to manually set the Ending Date to accommodate the extended range.

Properties.Name: InstructionalText
Properties.Value: Defines the working days of the week
